forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain showers. Mostly cloudy. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. West southwest wind around 16 mph, with gusts as high as 23 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain showers before 7pm, then rain. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 49. West wind 10 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the afternoon unfolds over Downtown San Francisco, a tale of shifting clouds and the whisper of rain emerges. The once-clear vistas now mutter hints of an impending shower, weaving a tapestry of gray across the sky. While the temperature gently hovers around 58 degrees, the wind whispers from the west-southwest, brisk enough to invigorate yet gentle enough to remind one of the city’s maritime charm. Rain showers dance on the horizon; a 40% chance beckons, encouraging urban explorers to carry an umbrella, as the gentle droplets may soon find their way to the cobbled streets.

As night approaches, the gathering clouds promise a more pronounced rainfall. With temperatures dipping to a respectful 49 degrees, a moderately brisk wind may nudge those unprepared for the evening chill. The air, infused with the freshness of impending rain, will feel both cool and invigorating, a reminder of the city’s coastal embrace. For those considering an evening stroll or perhaps a visit to a cozy café, layering up would be wise; a light jacket may shield against the dampness, while a warm scarf could offer comfort. Given these conditions, seek refuge in the simple pleasures of life: lose yourself in a book at a local café, embark on a quiet evening walk beneath the fog-kissed streetlights, or indulge in the warmth of a beloved restaurant as the city hums a tune of serenity.
